    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>
      
          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<span class="line"><!---->There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<!----></span><br>This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<!----></span><br><br>When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<span class="line"><!---->When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<span class="line"><!---->void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<span class="line"><!---->    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<!----></span><br>    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex < xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<span class="line"><!---->    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex &lt; xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer<gl::Buffer> &binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<span class="line"><!---->        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer&lt;gl::Buffer&gt; &amp;binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<!----></span><br>        ASSERT(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        ASSERT(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        if (bufferVk->isBufferValid())<span class="line"><!---->        if (bufferVk-&gt;isBufferValid())<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &bufferVk->getBuffer();<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &amp;bufferVk-&gt;getBuffer();<!----></span><br>            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<!----></span><br>                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]->getOffset();<span class="line"><!---->                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]-&gt;getOffset();<!----></span><br>            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<!----></span><br>            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<span class="line"><!---->|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<!----></span><br>And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<span class="line"><!---->And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    ....<span class="line"><!---->    ....<!----></span><br><br>    return contextVk->onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<span class="line"><!---->    return contextVk-&gt;onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<!----></span><br>                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<span class="line"><!---->                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>And in onBeginTransformFeedback, it uses the already freed buffer without any validation.<span class="line"><!---->And in onBeginTransformFeedback, it uses the already freed buffer without any validation.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback(<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback(<!----></span><br>    size_t bufferCount,<span class="line"><!---->    size_t bufferCount,<!----></span><br>    const gl::TransformFeedbackBuffersArray<vk::BufferHelper *> &buffers,<span class="line"><!---->    const gl::TransformFeedbackBuffersArray&lt;vk::BufferHelper *&gt; &amp;buffers,<!----></span><br>    const gl::TransformFeedbackBuffersArray<vk::BufferHelper> &counterBuffers)<span class="line"><!---->    const gl::TransformFeedbackBuffersArray&lt;vk::BufferHelper&gt; &amp;counterBuffers)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    onTransformFeedbackStateChanged();<span class="line"><!---->    onTransformFeedbackStateChanged();<!----></span><br><br>    bool shouldEndRenderPass = false;<span class="line"><!---->    bool shouldEndRenderPass = false;<!----></span><br><br>    // If any of the buffers were previously used in the render pass, break the render pass as a<span class="line"><!---->    // If any of the buffers were previously used in the render pass, break the render pass as a<!----></span><br>    // barrier is needed.<span class="line"><!---->    // barrier is needed.<!----></span><br>    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex < bufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<span class="line"><!---->    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex &lt; bufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        const vk::BufferHelper *buffer = buffers[bufferIndex];                  <--- can be freed<span class="line"><!---->        const vk::BufferHelper *buffer = buffers[bufferIndex];                  &lt;--- can be freed<!----></span><br>        if (mRenderPassCommands->usesBuffer(*buffer))<span class="line"><!---->        if (mRenderPassCommands-&gt;usesBuffer(*buffer))<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            shouldEndRenderPass = true;<span class="line"><!---->            shouldEndRenderPass = true;<!----></span><br>            break;<span class="line"><!---->            break;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br><br>This vulnerability causes a simple crash in Swiftshader.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability causes a simple crash in Swiftshader.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    ContextVk *contextVk                    = vk::GetImpl(context);<span class="line"><!---->    ContextVk *contextVk                    = vk::GetImpl(context);<!----></span><br>    const gl::ProgramExecutable *executable = contextVk->getState().getProgramExecutable();<span class="line"><!---->    const gl::ProgramExecutable *executable = contextVk-&gt;getState().getProgramExecutable();<!----></span><br>    ASSERT(executable);<span class="line"><!---->    ASSERT(executable);<!----></span><br>    size_t xfbBufferCount = executable->getTransformFeedbackBufferCount();<span class="line"><!---->    size_t xfbBufferCount = executable-&gt;getTransformFeedbackBufferCount();<!----></span><br><br>    if (contextVk->getFeatures().emulateTransformFeedback.enabled)<span class="line"><!---->    if (contextVk-&gt;getFeatures().emulateTransformFeedback.enabled)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        initializeXFBBuffersDesc(contextVk, xfbBufferCount);<span class="line"><!---->        initializeXFBBuffersDesc(contextVk, xfbBufferCount);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    return contextVk->onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<span class="line"><!---->    return contextVk-&gt;onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<!----></span><br>                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<span class="line"><!---->                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>On platforms without VK_EXT_transform_feedback(including Swiftshader), emulateTransformFeedback.enabled is true.<span class="line"><!---->On platforms without VK_EXT_transform_feedback(including Swiftshader), emulateTransformFeedback.enabled is true.<!----></span><br>Therefore, the initializeXFBBuffersDesc function is called.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, the initializeXFBBuffersDesc function is called.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<span class="line"><!---->void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<span class="line"><!---->    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<!----></span><br>    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex < xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<span class="line"><!---->    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex &lt; xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer<gl::Buffer> &binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<span class="line"><!---->        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer&lt;gl::Buffer&gt; &amp;binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<!----></span><br>        ASSERT(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        ASSERT(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */

          position: relative;
        }

          padding: 0;

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;

          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;

          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);

          flex-shrink: 0;

          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {

            flex-direction: column;

          .metadata-container {

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;

    display: inline;

    margin: 0;

  * appropriate heading levels.

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      <style>
        
  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
    --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }
  chops-button i.material-icons, a.button i.material-icons, .button i.material-icons {
    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;
    padding: 0.25em 0;
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    margin: 0;
    margin-top: 0.25em;
    border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
  }
  .medium-heading chops-button {
    line-height: 1.6;
  }
  .input-grid {
    padding: 0.5em 0;
    display: grid;
    max-width: 100%;
    grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }
  .input-grid label {
    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;
  }
  @media (max-width: 600px) {
    .input-grid label {
      margin-top: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      text-align: left;
    }
    .input-grid {
      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;
    }
  }

        mr-app {
          display: block;
          padding-top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-top: -1px; /* Prevent a double border from showing up. */

          /* From shared-styles.js. */
          --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
          --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;
          --mr-input-grid-gap: 6px;
          font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
          color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }

          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.

              <span></span><span class="help-title"><!---->Anywhere<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->/<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->focus on the issue search field<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->c<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->compose a new issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->s<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->star the current issue<!----></span>
              <!---->
                <span class="key-shortcut">
                  <!---->
                    <kbd><!---->?<!----></kbd>
                    <span class="key-separator" hidden=""> / </span>
                  <!---->:
                </span>
                <span class="key-tip"><!---->show this help dialog<!----></span>
              <!---->
            </div>
          <!---->
        </div>
        <p>
          Note: Only signed in users can star issues or add comments, and
          only project members can select issues for bulk edits.
        </p>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-keystrokes></mr-keystrokes>

          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<span class="line"><!---->There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<!----></span><br>This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<!----></span><br><br>When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<span class="line"><!---->When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<span class="line"><!---->void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<span class="line"><!---->    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<!----></span><br>    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex < xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<span class="line"><!---->    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex &lt; xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer<gl::Buffer> &binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<span class="line"><!---->        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer&lt;gl::Buffer&gt; &amp;binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<!----></span><br>        ASSERT(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        ASSERT(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        if (bufferVk->isBufferValid())<span class="line"><!---->        if (bufferVk-&gt;isBufferValid())<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &bufferVk->getBuffer();<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &amp;bufferVk-&gt;getBuffer();<!----></span><br>            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<!----></span><br>                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]->getOffset();<span class="line"><!---->                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]-&gt;getOffset();<!----></span><br>            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<!----></span><br>            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<span class="line"><!---->|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<!----></span><br>And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<span class="line"><!---->And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    ....<span class="line"><!---->    ....<!----></span><br><br>    return contextVk->onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<span class="line"><!---->    return contextVk-&gt;onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<!----></span><br>                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<span class="line"><!---->                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>And in onBeginTransformFeedback, it uses the already freed buffer without any validation.<span class="line"><!---->And in onBeginTransformFeedback, it uses the already freed buffer without any validation.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback(<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback(<!----></span><br>    size_t bufferCount,<span class="line"><!---->    size_t bufferCount,<!----></span><br>    const gl::TransformFeedbackBuffersArray<vk::BufferHelper *> &buffers,<span class="line"><!---->    const gl::TransformFeedbackBuffersArray&lt;vk::BufferHelper *&gt; &amp;buffers,<!----></span><br>    const gl::TransformFeedbackBuffersArray<vk::BufferHelper> &counterBuffers)<span class="line"><!---->    const gl::TransformFeedbackBuffersArray&lt;vk::BufferHelper&gt; &amp;counterBuffers)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    onTransformFeedbackStateChanged();<span class="line"><!---->    onTransformFeedbackStateChanged();<!----></span><br><br>    bool shouldEndRenderPass = false;<span class="line"><!---->    bool shouldEndRenderPass = false;<!----></span><br><br>    // If any of the buffers were previously used in the render pass, break the render pass as a<span class="line"><!---->    // If any of the buffers were previously used in the render pass, break the render pass as a<!----></span><br>    // barrier is needed.<span class="line"><!---->    // barrier is needed.<!----></span><br>    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex < bufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<span class="line"><!---->    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex &lt; bufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        const vk::BufferHelper *buffer = buffers[bufferIndex];                  <--- can be freed<span class="line"><!---->        const vk::BufferHelper *buffer = buffers[bufferIndex];                  &lt;--- can be freed<!----></span><br>        if (mRenderPassCommands->usesBuffer(*buffer))<span class="line"><!---->        if (mRenderPassCommands-&gt;usesBuffer(*buffer))<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            shouldEndRenderPass = true;<span class="line"><!---->            shouldEndRenderPass = true;<!----></span><br>            break;<span class="line"><!---->            break;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br><br>This vulnerability causes a simple crash in Swiftshader.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability causes a simple crash in Swiftshader.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    ContextVk *contextVk                    = vk::GetImpl(context);<span class="line"><!---->    ContextVk *contextVk                    = vk::GetImpl(context);<!----></span><br>    const gl::ProgramExecutable *executable = contextVk->getState().getProgramExecutable();<span class="line"><!---->    const gl::ProgramExecutable *executable = contextVk-&gt;getState().getProgramExecutable();<!----></span><br>    ASSERT(executable);<span class="line"><!---->    ASSERT(executable);<!----></span><br>    size_t xfbBufferCount = executable->getTransformFeedbackBufferCount();<span class="line"><!---->    size_t xfbBufferCount = executable-&gt;getTransformFeedbackBufferCount();<!----></span><br><br>    if (contextVk->getFeatures().emulateTransformFeedback.enabled)<span class="line"><!---->    if (contextVk-&gt;getFeatures().emulateTransformFeedback.enabled)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        initializeXFBBuffersDesc(contextVk, xfbBufferCount);<span class="line"><!---->        initializeXFBBuffersDesc(contextVk, xfbBufferCount);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    return contextVk->onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<span class="line"><!---->    return contextVk-&gt;onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<!----></span><br>                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<span class="line"><!---->                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>On platforms without VK_EXT_transform_feedback(including Swiftshader), emulateTransformFeedback.enabled is true.<span class="line"><!---->On platforms without VK_EXT_transform_feedback(including Swiftshader), emulateTransformFeedback.enabled is true.<!----></span><br>Therefore, the initializeXFBBuffersDesc function is called.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, the initializeXFBBuffersDesc function is         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion.             Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

            </chops-button>
            
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>

      </button>

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

    <mr-issue-page issueclosed=""><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        for LitElement.

        <slot></slot>
      </label>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
