        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>
    <mr-click-throughs></mr-click-throughs>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<span class="line"><!---->There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<!----></span><br>This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<!----></span><br><br>When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<span class="line"><!---->When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<span class="line"><!---->void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<span class="line"><!---->    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<!----></span><br>    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; &amp;binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<!----></span><br>        ASSERT(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        ASSERT(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        if (bufferVk->isBufferValid())<span class="line"><!---->        if (bufferVk-&gt;isBufferValid())<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &bufferVk->getBuffer();<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &amp;bufferVk-&gt;getBuffer();<!----></span><br>            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<!----></span><br>                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]->getOffset();<span class="line"><!---->                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]-&gt;getOffset();<!----></span><br>            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<!----></span><br>            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<span class="line"><!---->|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<!----></span><br>And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<span class="line"><!---->And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

        Congratulations, SeongHwan! The VRP Panel has decided to award you $10,000 for this report. Thank you for your efforts and excellent work in reporting GPU process memory corruption bugs!<span class="line"><!---->Congratulations, SeongHwan!         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Issue 1313905: Security: [ANGLE] Heap use-after-free in ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback
          <h1>
            
            Issue 1313905: Security: [ANGLE] Heap use-after-free in ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback
          </h1>
          
            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      schedule<i id="availability-icon" class="material-icons inline-icon ${user.last_visit_timestamp ? '': 'inline-icon-unseen'}" title="undefined" hidden="">schedule</i>
      ggabu...@gmail.com<a id="user-link" href="/u/310537447" title="ggabu...@gmail.com"><!---->ggabu...@gmail.com<!----></a>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<span class="line"><!---->There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<!----></span><br>This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<!----></span><br><br>When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<span class="line"><!---->When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<span class="line"><!---->void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<span class="line"><!---->    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<!----></span><br>    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex < xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<span class="line"><!---->    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex &lt; xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer<gl::Buffer> &binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<span class="line"><!---->        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer&lt;gl::Buffer&gt; &amp;binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<!----></span><br>        ASSERT(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        ASSERT(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        if (bufferVk->isBufferValid())<span class="line"><!---->        if (bufferVk-&gt;isBufferValid())<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &bufferVk->getBuffer();<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &amp;bufferVk-&gt;getBuffer();<!----></span><br>            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<!----></span><br>                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]->getOffset();<span class="line"><!---->                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]-&gt;getOffset();<!----></span><br>            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<!----></span><br>            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<span class="line"><!---->|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<!----></span><br>And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<span class="line"><!---->And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    ....<span class="line"><!---->    ....<!----></span><br><br>    return contextVk->onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<span class="line"><!---->    return contextVk-&gt;onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<!----></span><br>                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<span class="line"><!---->                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>And in onBeginTransformFeedback, it uses the already freed buffer without any validation.<span class="line"><!---->And in onBeginTransformFeedback, it uses the already freed buffer without any validation.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b                                       mCounterBufferHelpers);<span class="line"><!---->                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<!----></span><br>}<span emulateTransformFeedback.enabled is true.<span class="line"><!---->On platforms without VK_EXT_transform_feedback(including Swiftshader), emulateTransformFeedback.enabled is true.<!----></span><br>Therefore, the initializeXFBBuffersDesc function is called.<span class="line"><!---->Therefore, the initializeXFBBuffersDesc function is         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>
      </div>
    
      
    <mr-comment headinglevel="2" commenterismember=""></mr-comment>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

      VULNERABILITY DETAILS<b class="line"><!---->VULNERABILITY DETAILS<!----></b><br>There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<span class="line"><!---->There is a heap uss-after-free vulnerability that is caused by the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function.<!----></span><br>This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability exists in the Vulkan backend.<!----></span><br><br>When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<span class="line"><!---->When glBeginTransformFeedback() is called, the TransformFeedbackVk::begin function calls initializeXFBBuffersDesc.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<span class="line"><!---->void TransformFeedbackVk::initializeXFBBuffersDesc(ContextVk *contextVk, size_t xfbBufferCount)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<span class="line"><!---->    mXFBBuffersDesc.reset();<!----></span><br>    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex < xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<span class="line"><!---->    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex &lt; xfbBufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer<gl::Buffer> &binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<span class="line"><!---->        const gl::OffsetBindingPointer&lt;gl::Buffer&gt; &amp;binding = mState.getIndexedBuffer(bufferIndex);<!----></span><br>        ASSERT(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        ASSERT(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<span class="line"><!---->        BufferVk *bufferVk = vk::GetImpl(binding.get());<!----></span><br><br>        if (bufferVk->isBufferValid())<span class="line"><!---->        if (bufferVk-&gt;isBufferValid())<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &bufferVk->getBuffer();<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex] = &amp;bufferVk-&gt;getBuffer();<!----></span><br>            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferOffsets[bufferIndex] =<!----></span><br>                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]->getOffset();<span class="line"><!---->                binding.getOffset() + mBufferHelpers[bufferIndex]-&gt;getOffset();<!----></span><br>            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferSizes[bufferIndex] = gl::GetBoundBufferAvailableSize(binding);<!----></span><br>            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<span class="line"><!---->            mBufferObserverBindings[bufferIndex].bind(bufferVk);<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<span class="line"><!---->|mBufferHelpers| has a buffer bound to GL_TRANSFORM_FEEDBACK_BUFFER. This buffer can be freed by glDeleteBuffer().<!----></span><br>And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<span class="line"><!---->And in the glResumeTransformFeedback() function, the ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback function is called with the |mBufferHelpers| argument.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    ....<span class="line"><!---->    ....<!----></span><br><br>    return contextVk->onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<span class="line"><!---->    return contextVk-&gt;onBeginTransformFeedback(xfbBufferCount, mBufferHelpers,<!----></span><br>                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<span class="line"><!---->                                               mCounterBufferHelpers);<!----></span><br>}<span class="line"><!---->}<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br>And in onBeginTransformFeedback, it uses the already freed buffer without any validation.<span class="line"><!---->And in onBeginTransformFeedback, it uses the already freed buffer without any validation.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result ContextVk::onBeginTransformFeedback(<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result &amp;counterBuffers)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    onTransformFeedbackStateChanged();<span class="line"><!----> buffers were previously used in the render pass, break the render pass as a<span class="line"><!---->    // If any of the buffers were previously used in the render pass, break the render pass as a<!----></span><br>    // barrier is needed.<span class="line"><!---->    // barrier is needed.<!----></span><br>    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex < bufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<span class="line"><!---->    for (size_t bufferIndex = 0; bufferIndex &lt; bufferCount; ++bufferIndex)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        const vk::BufferHelper *buffer = buffers[bufferIndex];                  <--- can be freed<span class="line"><!---->        const vk::BufferHelper *buffer = buffers[bufferIndex];                  &lt;--- can be freed<!----></span><br>        if (mRenderPassCommands->usesBuffer(*buffer))<span class="line"><!---->        if (mRenderPassCommands-&gt;usesBuffer(*buffer))<!----></span><br>        {<span class="line"><!---->        {<!----></span><br>            shouldEndRenderPass = true;<span class="line"><!---->            shouldEndRenderPass = true;<!----></span><br>            break;<span class="line"><!---->            break;<!----></span><br>        }<span class="line"><!---->        }<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br><br><br><br><br><br><br>This vulnerability causes a simple crash in Swiftshader.<span class="line"><!---->This vulnerability causes a simple crash in Swiftshader.<!----></span><br>-------------------------<b class="line"><!---->-------------------------<!----></b>--------------------------------------------------------------<span class="line"><!---->--------------------------------------------------------------<!----></span><br>angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<span class="line"><!---->angle::Result TransformFeedbackVk::resume(const gl::Context *context)<!----></span><br>{<span class="line"><!---->{<!----></span><br>    ContextVk *contextVk                    = vk::GetImpl(context);<span class="line"><!---->    ContextVk *contextVk                    = vk::GetImpl(context);<!----></span><br>    const gl::ProgramExecutable *executable = contextVk->getState().getProgramExecutable();<span class="line"><!---->    const gl::ProgramExecutable *executable = contextVk-&gt;getState().getProgramExecutable();<!----></span><br>    ASSERT(executable);<span class="line"><!---->    ASSERT(executable);<!----></span><br>    size_t xfbBufferCount = executable->getTransformFeedbackBufferCount();<span class="line"><!---->    size_t xfbBufferCount = executable-&gt;getTransformFeedbackBufferCount();<!----></span><br><br>    if (contextVk->getFeatures().emulateTransformFeedback.enabled)<span class="line"><!---->    if (contextVk-&gt;getFeatures().emulateTransformFeedback.enabled)<!----></span><br>    {<span class="line"><!---->    {<!----></span><br>        initializeXFBBuffersDesc(contextVk, xfbBufferCount);<span class="line"><!---->        initializeXFBBuffersDesc(contextVk, xfbBufferCount);<!----></span><br>    }<span class="line"><!---->    }<!----></span><br><br>    return         *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

        <div class="target-project-dialog">
          <h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          <div class="input-grid">
            <label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            <div>
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
